required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment for Teachers With Vocal Fatigue
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiovascular Conditioning in the Treatment of Vocal Fatigue

brief_summary.textblock: Teachers are a population at high risk for voice disorders given their occupational demands. In a teaching career, a common debilitating symptom among all vocal symptoms experienced is - vocal fatigue, impacting teachers' occupational performance and increasing health care costs. It is therefore essential to identify potential treatment options to alleviate the symptom of vocal fatigue. The purpose of this study is to utilize a body-system level cardiovascular training protocol in comparison to traditional voice production training to alleviate the symptoms of vocal fatigue.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Physiologic Cost of Speaking
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Physiologic Cost of Speaking is measured as the rate of oxygen consumption at steady state/ rate of speech (wpm) for each of the two reading tasks

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Oxygen Uptake Kinetics is measured as the pattern of oxygen use during each of the two reading tasks

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Post Task Physiological Recovery
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Post Task Physiological Recovery is measured as the time, seconds, to reach baseline of oxygen consumption post task (within 0.2ml/kg/min) following each of the reading tasks

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Excess Post Exercise Consumption (EPOC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: EPOC is measured as the magnitude of recovery oxygen consumption, ml/kg/min for each of the reading tasks

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Ratings of Perceived Exertion (RPE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Borg Scale of Ratings of Perceived Exertion (RPE)- measures the self-report of vocal effort for each of the reading tasks

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Vocal Fatigue Index (VFI) is a retrospective scale that measures self-reported symptoms of vocal fatigue

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Global Rating of Vocal Fatigue (VAS 100mm)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 4 weeks after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Global Rating of Vocal Fatigue (VAS 100mm) measures the ability to sustain voice with no fatigue at the end of a working day

arm_group.description: Participants will complete a sub maximal cardiovascular training program twice per week for a period of 4 weeks.
Participants will complete voice production exercises twice per week for a period of 4 weeks.

intervention.description: Participants will be randomized to either one of the treatment arms to receive treatment for a period of 4 weeks.
Participants will be randomized to either one of the treatment arms to receive treatment for a period of 4 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female teachers between the ages of 21-45 years
- A score of ≥ 15 on factor 1 of the VFI (tiredness and avoidance of voice use) or a score of ≤ 5 on factor 3 of the VFI (improvement of symptoms or lack thereof with rest)
- Sedentary- wherein participants will need to be completing cardiovascular exercise less than 20-30 minutes per day and less than 3 days per week
Exclusion Criteria:
- Trained athletes
- Trained singers
- Smoking in the past 6months
- Prior history of a vocal fold pathology and current vocal fold pathology
